results.name: Triangle read by rows: row n gives digits of n in factorial base.
comment: Row lengths are A084558. This sequence contains every finite sequence of nonnegative integers.
T(n,k)=A235168(n,k) for k=0..23; a(n) = A235168(n) for n=0..63, when both tables are seen as flattened lists. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 05 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..2000 of triangle, flattened
C. A. Laisant, Sur la numération factorielle, application aux permutations, Bulletin de la Société Mathématique de France, 16 (1888), p. 176-183.
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: For example, 11 in factorial base is 121 (1*6 + 2*2 + 1*1), so row 11 is 1,2,1.
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = Module[{q, r}, If[n < i, {n}, {q, r} = QuotientRemainder[n, i]; Append[b[q, i + 1], r]]];
Table[T[n], {n, 0, 40}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 03 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: a108731_row n = t n $ reverse $ takeWhile (<= n) $ tail a000142_list
t x (b:bs) = x' : t m bs where (x',m) = divMod x b
